name: Circle of the Shepherd
description: Druids of the Circle of the Shepherd commune with the spirits of nature, especially those of beasts and the fey. They focus on protecting animals and fey creatures, using their powers to guard and support these beings against threats.

speech_of_the_woods.description: You gain the ability to speak, read, and write Sylvan. Beasts understand your speech, and you can decipher their noises and motions. This does not grant special friendship, but can be combined with gifts to gain favor.

spirit_totem.description: You can summon an incorporeal spirit that creates an aura in a 30-foot radius. The spirit lasts for 1 minute and has various effects depending on the type summoned: Bear Spirit (temporary hit points and advantage on Strength checks), Hawk Spirit (advantage on attack rolls and Perception checks), or Unicorn Spirit (advantage on detecting creatures and healing spell effects).

bear_spirit.effect: Grants temporary hit points equal to 5 + your druid level and advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.

hawk_spirit.effect: Grants advantage on attack rolls against targets in the aura and advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

unicorn_spirit.effect: Grants advantage on detecting creatures in the aura and healing effects from spells restore hit points to allies in the aura.

mighty_summoner.description: Beasts and fey you conjure have 2 extra hit points per Hit Die and their natural weapons are considered magical for overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks.

guardian_spirit.description: Beasts and fey you summon or create regain hit points equal to half your druid level when they end their turn in your Spirit Totem aura.

faithful_summons.description: When reduced to 0 hit points or incapacitated, you can immediately cast Conjure Animals at 9th level, summoning four beasts of challenge rating 2 or lower. The beasts appear within 20 feet of you and act to protect you. This feature lasts for 1 hour and canâ€™t be used again until after a long rest.
